Text:
The sound of enthusiastic applause returned to Beit HaNasi this evening for the first time since the outbreak of #coronavirus, marking #InternationalWomensDay with @HabimaTheatre and Haifa Theater's tribute to women in theater: "Women Create Israeli Theater"
The show must go on! https://t.co/3rNOdqzTnM

With Dor, Carmel and Khouloud at a Tel-Aviv Yafo youth center, who told me about the tough socio-economic impact of #coronavirus. 
I believe in our young people and we must not lose them. We must grow together out of this crisis and rebuild our economy in the digital, global era. https://t.co/TcE9FbiLLN

The prospect of snow didn't stop us going out to support the medical teams today at Jerusalem's @herzog_hospital, working round the clock with elderly patients and the young on respiratory support to fight #coronavirus.
It is our shared duty to protect and care for our elderly. https://t.co/YM534FabBt

A working meeting with Pres. @AnastasiadesCY of #Cyprus. I welcome the recent agreement on flights and tourism between our countries and call on others to adopt 'Green Passes'. #Coronavirus has shown us that today's challenges know no borders. We must work together to meet them. https://t.co/KwSGkeZSOL

Receiving the Unity Scroll of the Social Forum today, Rav Grossman's initiative aimed at healing the rifts in Israeli society, particularly with #coronavirus. 
Unity and mutual responsibility - our Jewish and democratic 'togetherness' - are key to getting through this challenge. https://t.co/NiEN519Tp3
Thank you to the medical teams, from the bottom of my heart, from me and all Israelis. Thank you for your boundless dedication in fighting the pandemic. You're the best! https://t.co/1SC810r0v7

Visiting Shamir Medical Center today in support of the medical teams dealing with #coronavirus.
The innovative breath test I tried gives an immediate corona diagnosis and could replace the swab test, and the hyperbaric chamber does wonders for those with respiratory difficulties https://t.co/4eqTbjyFYM

Receiving the Children in Israel report from the National Council for the Child, with worrying data on #coronavirus and our children.
We citizens must say: after the elections our elected officials must ensure a good present and a better future for our children. All our children https://t.co/avjMOt5j98

Visiting new mothers today, I spoke with Ilana and her beautiful baby Lia on the corona ward at Ichilov Medical Center. I heard about the huge difficulties of giving birth during the pandemic and the wonderful support of the medical teams. Mazal tov, dear Ilana! https://t.co/IIBifAKLID

Meeting today with heads of Israel's hospitals and hearing their difficulties, which are our difficulties. 
We cannot allow our public hospitals to collapse. We cannot allow #coronavirus to defeat our hospitals, We cannot beat it without them. https://t.co/9f9qyDdPU8

Saluting special education, the teachers, therapists and all those who continue to envelop our special children with love during these difficult days of #coronavirus. Visiting @BeitIssie today, and sending my thanks and blessings to you all, across the country. https://t.co/3H0hMf0RQ1

There will be better days. We have gone through bad times in the past and overcome them. The effect of the vaccine is close at hand. We will return to normality. Until then, be patient and disciplined and do everything to minimize infection.

https://t.co/jLLOFdjTVl

Just before the lockdown, today we distributed the 5000th computer through Mitchashvim to school kids from all parts of Israeli society.

 We will continue to close the digital gap together with our many partners in this important initiative, making sure no child is left behind. https://t.co/P5V7EIqHHi

There will be better days. We have gone through bad times in the past and overcome them. The effect of the vaccine is close at hand, and we will return to normality. Until then, we must be patient and disciplined, and do everything we can to minimize infection.

Do your duty. The lockdown, with all its restrictions as decided by the government, applies to us all. We are going into lockdown to protect our children. We, all of us and without exceptions, must follow its rules.

https://t.co/3sLPRjIgy9

Meeting the wonderful healthcare workers at the Maccabi vaccination center today in Jerusalem. Two weeks into this huge operation, it was very exciting to see thousands of people getting the vaccine every hour. At this pace, we can turn the corner and start to get back to normal. https://t.co/hk9lvaOgPw
I got the corona vaccine. Dear Israelis, go and get vaccinated too. https://t.co/yhRny4ynMN

Speaking to @Pontifex ahead of Christmas in the shadow of #coronavirus. We have a moral obligation to ensure that all countries receive the vaccine and to follow instructions, even at the expense of our holiday celebrations. Wishing all Christian communities a Merry Christmas! https://t.co/nxJpNFmN4q

Working meeting with FM @AranchaGlezLaya of #Spain, during which we talked about #coronavirus that we are all dealing with. 
I sent my support to the Spanish people affected by the disease and my hopes that we will soon get through this difficult time. https://t.co/ap0BfKwc5E

I was happy to hear that the first doses of vaccine are expected to arrive in #Israel in the next few days. 

I'm ready, of course.
For nearly a year, we have been living only in the present. The global pandemic has created a health, social and economic crisis across the world, and here in Israel.

Meeting heads of the Christian denominations in Israel with COGAT ahead of #Christmas. With #coronavirus, I asked the church leaders to stress the importance of following the guidelines to their communities, and wished them an early Happy Christmas https://t.co/0k7yVQ4q8l

The virus of antisemitism, racism and xenophobia is tougher than coronavirus. It changes shape, takes cover and threatens to break out through any crack. But there can and there must be a vaccine for it, too.

I was glad to hear that the infection rate is falling, but there are also warning lights. We need a large number of tests to halt the spread of the disease. My fellow Israelis - please do not ignore it. Go and get tested. https://t.co/ft4n01hvxj

The first stage in @IDF's operation to deal with #coronavirus patients at Rambam hospital has ended, and I went to show my appreciation to the medical and support teams. I heard from the patients about the wonderful care they received. https://t.co/qjuF2WpyuG

Even when it's raining and under the #coronavirus restrictions, it was an honor to receive credentials today from the new ambassadors of #Belgium, #Uzbekistan, #Sweden, #Norway and #Latvia to #Israel. To many more years of friendship between our countries and peoples üáßüá™üá∫üáøüá∏üá™üá≥üá¥üá±üáªüáÆüá± https://t.co/qu6fowSBvW

I also visited the Sion Medical factory, a leading global brand for masks and protective equipment. Great pride for Israel. 
Wearing a mask is vital - and if we can support local industry at the same time, even better. https://t.co/a803JdQKS9

Visiting Sderot today to hear how they have successfully contained the coronavirus pandemic led by mayor @AlonDavidi. The impressive control room he opened gives personal service to each one of the residents. https://t.co/eAk2wvwHLG

A working meeting with Italian FM @luigidimaio 
I sent our prayers to all Italians and to the country's Jewish community, which have been hit hard by #coronavirus. We will continue to cultivate the good relations between our countries and work together to beat the pandemic. https://t.co/cC5KBAB6qa

Keep your distance, wear a mask and wash hands. #GlobalHandwashingDay2020 is a great reminder of the simple steps we all need to take to keep ouselves and each other safe and to beat #COVID19 https://t.co/R96dyAIvjb

Beit HaNasi is joining @zakaHQ's "Don't Leave Them Behind" project. We will call elderly people living on their own to see how they are doing. 
#coronavirus and #loneliness are two deadly diseases, and fighting one of them cannot mean that we neglect those who are alone. https://t.co/niK1dPLzcu

Signing the first pardon of the special process we launched during #coronavirus.
A mounting debt owed by a single mother, a victim of domestic violence who got out of sex work, was forgiven.
We will continue to do all we can for those who need #help in these tough times. https://t.co/F17jQ0DkhB

I have asked the government to apply the freeze and reduction in wages to my salary, too. 

This follows yesterday's government decision, in light of the economic state because of #coronavirus, to reduce salaries of MKs, ministers and the prime minister by 10% https://t.co/UFJ3ImGtXH

Announcing today with justice minister @AviNissenkorn a special pardon process for those who owe fines and are in financial difficulties because of #coronavirus. At a time like this, the State of Israel must help those who need it and are fighting for their lives financially.

As the lockdown comes into force and we are in our homes, tens of thousands of policemen and women are deployed across the country, for us and to protect our personal security and our health. https://t.co/dkckibfTZB

Since the outbreak of the pandemic, I have gone to where the battle is being fought and met with those who care for you, my fellow Israelis, and are doing everything to win this battle, and I ask you ‚Äì put your trust in them.

I think of those with mental health issues in hostels, of soldiers, of parents in old-age homes. The lockdown means that our ability to live together, to celebrate together, to mourn together, to pray together, to fulfil our most basic human needs together ‚Äì all these are harmed.

When the coronavirus burst into our lives, we thought it would be a tough battle, but we hoped for a swift victory and so we accepted the restrictions of social distancing with understanding, despite the costs it entails.

I understand the feelings of confusion and uncertainty, the anxiety that many people are feeling. I understand and, first and foremost, want to apologize for that. On a personal level, I ask your forgiveness for my behavior here at Beit HaNasi during the lockdown during Pesach.

Working meeting with Alternate PM and Minister of Defense @gantzbe discussing the security situation n the south and north of the country,  new opportunities with the normalization of relations with UAE and @IDF efforts to dealing with the #Coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/CuwE8u7fCQ

We have learned recently that we cannot live in a bubble, unaware  of those around us. Today, at the @TelAviv-Yafo municipality's #coronavirus control room, I met people who work for others, for all those among us who are finding things tough. https://t.co/40DMzgyOzN

Meeting today with Health Minister @YuliEdelstein and D-G of @IsraelMOH who briefed me on current patient numbers and efforts to halt the spread of the virus.
Beit HaNasi will assist the ministry in any way required. I am confident will get through these tough times together. https://t.co/M6XWTcdBym

Receiving diplomatic credentials, in a different and smaller ceremony in line with coronavirus restrictions, from new #ambassadors to #Israel. Welcome to the ambassadors of Colombia üá®üá¥ Greece üá¨üá∑ Denmark üá©üá∞ Romania üá∑üá¥ and Argentina üá¶üá∑!
@IsraelMFA https://t.co/HB57Tp6s5r

Visiting Eilat, Israel's tourism capital where the sun always shines, this morning. I met residents, hoteliers and business people who are dealing with coronavirus. 
Holiday in Israel, if you can - in hotels, tents or guesthouses - all according to the guidelines, of course! https://t.co/d8Q0Xh7bGK

It was a pleasure to speak to President @s_sommaruga of #Switzerland, a long-standing friend of Israel. We spoke about the coronavirus pandemic in our countries, about areas of cooperation in fighting it and about the regional challenges we face at this time.

You, the men and women graduates @IAFsite flight school's 180th course, overcame all obstacles, touched the blue beyond and proved that for you the sky is no limit. We are proud of you. Spread your wings, fly high and come home safely. https://t.co/cBnKMYIleS
Visiting the laboratories of the Brain Sciences Center at the Hebrew University of Jerusalem today, where they are doing groundbreaking work to fight coronavirus, https://t.co/M0RxXK7bpI

Holding a first working meeting since the outbreak of #coronavirus today with @PrimeministerGR Kyriakos Mitsotakis. His visit in these challenging days is further testimony to the strong relations between our countries. I hope flights between Tel Aviv and Athens resume soon üáÆüá±üá¨üá∑ https://t.co/VFzDGFgFgW

At the same time, an epidemiological investigation is being carried out under the close instructions of the District Health Officer and tests for coronavirus are being carried out according to need and contact with the affected employee.

Beit HaNasi has been cleaned after receiving information yesterday that one of its workers has coronavirus, disinfecting all offices, including bathrooms and kitchens. The president‚Äôs private office was cleaned thoroughly and he will resume working from it tomorrow. https://t.co/WOPHpN3M7h

During Shabbat, Beit HaNasi was informed that one of its members of staff tested positive for coronavirus.
Consultations are now taking place with relevant authorities from the Ministry of Health regarding who will be required to isolate, and the implications for President Rivlin

Together with FM @Gabi_Ashkenazi on a video conference this evening with American Jewish leaders in light of current events there and #coronavirus. We stand together with our brothers and sisters in Jewish communities around the world against all forms of antisemitism and racism. https://t.co/fNbn2O9ZDL

A fascinating visit to @ElbitSystemsLtd. I thanked them for the incredible speed with which they sought solutions for @coronavirus, producing a portable ventilator and comms systems for hospitals. Our advanced technological capacity is the heart of our security advantage https://t.co/AJ7SszSnEh

Speaking to President Milo ƒêukanoviƒá of Montenegro today, I said the international community must face #coronavirus together as it crosses boundaries and touches all peoples. We will continue to work together to find solutions to make our world safer again. 
@predsjednik_cg

I spoke to my friend the President of Germany to mark 55 years of diplomatic relations between our countries. Unfortunately #coronavirus kept us apart. Israel-German relations have strengthened in recent years and cooperation, so important right now, will continue to flourish.

Speaking today with Gov @PhilMurphyNJ of New Jersey, expressing our solidarity as we fight coronavirus. Thank you for your important work to combat antisemitism and your commitment to the Jewish community, particularly at this sensitive time. We hope to see you in Israel soon!

I call on the government not to ignore their calls and to pay the full amount promised, a need even greater with #coronavirus. The new government should set out a 5-year plan, with municipal leaders, and ensure it properly answers the needs of Druze and Circassian authorities. https://t.co/pO1z4p4Ck2

Visiting the #Israel Institute for Biological Research today with DM @naftalibennett. They have made a world-class breakthrough, identifying a series of antibodies to fight #coronavirus. The dedication and passion of the scientists is truly inspiring. https://t.co/MQL4lVnKoG

A unique comms system to connect ICUs and a ventilator assembly line for #coronavirus patients - just two of the incredible developments by the @IDF's Intelligence Branch's tech unit that I saw on my visit today. Thank you for your round-the-clock dedication to #Israel's security https://t.co/mLmj1dTdu8

Speaking to @NYGovCuomo about the #coronavirus crisis and the tough times New York State and NYC, including our brothers and sisters in the #Jewish community, are going through. We stand with them all and will carry on working together to fight this terrible disease. 
@NYGov

Important meeting today with FM @KahlonMoshe and UN MEPP Special Coordinator @nmladenov, together with @cogatonline @IDF. We were briefed on the current situation of joint resources and thinking with the Palestinians to halt the spread of #coronavirus, which knows no boundaries. https://t.co/g63dXDCt8O

Selling #Pesach chametz today with Sephardi Chief Rabbi of #Jerusalem Shlomo Moshe Amar, I spoke out strongly against the criticism of the ultra-Orthodox community. We must not make false accusations about the spread of #coronavirus based on the bad actions of a few individuals. https://t.co/7Mt1Wfhcyd

Speaking today with President @EmmanuelMacron, UN Special Coordinator @nmladenov and British Ambassador to #Israel @FCONeilWigan, I said that international cooperation is crucial in our battle against #coronavirus. https://t.co/u6DL12s4zv

Speaking to the Minister of Health and PMO today following the @IsraelMOH decision to move the elderly and frail, including Holocaust survivors, from their hospital beds to care for #coronavirus patients. The decision should be reconsidered. We must not abandon our elderly.

I sent messages for the speedy recovery of HRH Prince Charles @ClarenceHouse, PM @BorisJohnson, HSH Albert II and PM Serge Telle of #Monaco who have contracted #coronavirus, which ignores national borders. International cooperation is vital to beat it. Together, we will overcome.

Speaking today to the presidents of #Austria, #Cyprus and #Geece about #coronavirus , I wished their citizens good health and heard how the countries are dealing with the spread of the virus. They expressed their support and solidarity with #Israel. We appreciate your friendship!

Meeting with #Egypt's ambassador to #Israel in light of #coronavirus, I said that Israel will cooperate in any way with Egypt and the peoples of the region in the fight against the disease. https://t.co/oMp2VdiZdr

Speaking today with the president of #Croatia, who took office in January, I said I was sorry that #coronavirus was our first occasion to talk. I thanked him for the assistance in getting 70 #Israeli students back home and stressed our strong and important bilateral relations.

Speaking today with the president of #Czechia about #coronavirus, I said #Israelis are standing with #Czechs in solidarity. The spread of the disease and steps taken by both governments are similar. Both peoples knew how to overcome past challenges and will know how to rebuild

Excellent meeting with my friend  Minister of Defense @naftalibennett. Long discussion about #Israel's preparations to combat #coronavirus and the solutions our people are working on so our emergency forces can work to the best of their ability. https://t.co/Pcmkv7SHWT

Meeting with Minister of Labor, Social Affairs and Social Welfare Ofir Akunis about #coronavirus. For many, staying at home for a long period of time is difficult and domestic violence is a particular problem. Thanks to all the teams helping those in need at this time https://t.co/kMmu1vezME

Speaking with President @dodon_igor of #Moldova about #coronavirus today, I thanked him for helping over 800 #Israeli students leave the country and agreed to continue our cooperation to fight the virus.

Speaking with the President of #Armenia today about the #coronavirus, we discussed possible cooperation and information exchange about how our health systems are dealing with the disease.
@armgov

Speaking today with King Felipe of #Spain about #coronavirus, I told him we in #Israel are with the Spanish people as they deal with its spread. I thanked him for the cooperation of the Spanish airports in helping Israelis get home from South and Central America. 
@CasaReal

With every update on the spread of  #coronavirus that we hear from around and the world we also think of you, our family abroad, and pray that you are staying strong, united, healthy and well.

https://t.co/KTbC1pjwwi

Meeting with Minister of Health Yaakov Litzman, director-general of the ministry and the @IsraelMOH team who updated me on those who have #Coronavid19 and the steps to contain its spread in #Israel. Thank you for your dedication and great care for the welfare of all Israelis https://t.co/hShoB2eVeV

I spoke this morning with Ofer in #China. His Facebook posts from #Wuhan fill our hearts with prayers this difficult time ends soon. I sent him and his family hugs from us all. We pray a return to normality. 
We are with you, dear Ofer. We are with you, dear people of China. üáÆüá±üá®üá≥ https://t.co/m5YnEZUoDd

Got my first dose of the vaccination against COVID-19 this morning. Thanking sister Ramya PC, for her care and professionalism. Fortunate to be in India, where development and dissemination has been prompt and affordable. #vaccinated https://t.co/4ejylZdv1U

Today marks 2 years of PM-Kisan Samman Nidhi. Over 11 cr farmers, each, receive an income support of ‚Çπ6000/year. Even through the pandemic, through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) all 3 instalments amounting to Rs 58,600 crore was released by 25th Dec ‚Äò20.

#KisanKaSammanPMKisan https://t.co/pJ90nOskVo

Leading from the front in addressing the challenges of #Corona, @PMOIndia @narendramodi extended unwavering support for vaccine development and production in India. As a result today, we see across India, a rollout of #COVID19Vaccination 
#SabKaSaathSabKaVikas
#AtmaNirbharBharat https://t.co/F6v08rO96e

An account of how ‚Å¶@PMOIndia‚Å© is leading us from the front during the pandemic.
‚ÄúResponding swiftly to each trial thrown up by the war against Covid, Modi displayed a firm belief in optimising social capital and in the power of the collective.‚Äù https://t.co/16CpCobfcy

8. But in recent past we see the basis for protest is not the policy decision but doubts & rumours. False propaganda- the decision is okay but going forward somethings may happen- is spread.
Fear is being spread about what‚Äôs not happened & that which will ever happen. #FarmLaws

4. We had promised that we‚Äôll stop blackmarket in urea and we‚Äôll ensure it‚Äôs adequate supply. In the past 6years we ensured that there were no shortages. Even during the lockdown there were no difficulty. #FarmLaws

Marking 75 years of @UN @PMOIndia addresses the General Assembly. Recalls the transformational changes in the last 6 years that positively changed our lives. Calls for reforms to the @UN. Commits that our vaccine production and distribution systems will benefit #mankind. https://t.co/xZxoIbwXAJ

The C&AG Report No 20 of 2019...Defence Offset Performance was scheduled to be tabled in the Parliament during budget session (2020). The session ended, before date, due to COVID. Now the report will be placed in the next session. The contents will be known only after that.

@BSYBJP Good to see your message Hon. CM @BSYBJP avare.  Appreciate your well-meaning advice to everyone to take all precautions against #coronavirus.
My prayers for your speedy recovery.

The Cabinet under the leadership of @PMOIndia @narendramodi gave approval for extending #PMGKAY - Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana upto end November. 81.09 crore people would rightly get free food grains (5kg/person) for 8 continuous months. #coronavirus

Karyakarta of @BJP4India in the service of the nation during the #Corona pandemic. 
Today‚Äôs review in the presence of @PMOIndia @narendramodi and adhyaksh @JPNadda included @BJP4Assam @BJP4Bihar @BJP4Delhi @BJP4Rajasthan @BJP4Maharashtra @BJP4Karnataka and @BJP4UP https://t.co/5MuXNmC89I

During the #Corona pandemic @BJP4India and all state units undertook service for the poor and the needy. Cooked food, ration, medicines, face mask, migrant care were provided. @PMOIndia @narendramodi and adhyaksh @JPNadda reviewed the activities 7 states. #SevaHiSangthan https://t.co/s5zgXOj4xy
Lockdown helped avert 3 million deaths in Europe: Study - The Hindu BusinessLine. ‚Å¶@MoHFW_INDIA‚Å© ‚Å¶@mygovindia‚Å© ‚Å¶@PIB_India‚Å© ‚Å¶@NITIAayog‚Å©  https://t.co/6N7QR8i81t

Addressing #CIIAnnualSession2020 @PMOIndia said that India has left the lockdown and has entered #Unlock1. This is become possible because when across the world #Corona was spreading, at the right time India took the right step in the right way. @PMOIndia
Nirmala Sitharaman interview: FM speaks on coronavirus India lockdown, Atmanirbhar Bharat Abhiyan economic package.. ‚Å¶@IndianExpress‚Å©  https://t.co/FGoZPQbP5D

Indian economy has acquired strength in its various dimensions. Now, we can confidently engage with the world. We aim at overall transformation & not incremental changes. We shall convert the pandemic challenge into an opportunity. #AatmanirbharBharat will integrate not isolate.
India has to become #selfreliant. This pandemic has provided an opportunity for us to make the 21st  century an Indian century , says @PMOIndia @narendramodi

‚Å¶‚Å¶@PMOIndia‚Å© leads India‚Äôs fight against #coronavirus from the front. His popularity is over 70% finds survey by @TimesNow‚Å©. Shows people‚Äôs confidence in the leadership of ‚Å¶@narendramodi‚Å© during extraordinary times caused by pandemic.

https://t.co/7MU8Pp7AGl

Public opinion based approval ratings of world leaders shown in the charts. @PMOIndia leads #IndiaFightsCorona from the front. Consistent high approval ratings for @narendramodi. Nation has confidence in its leadership in an extraordinary situation due a pandemic. https://t.co/fwrRDsp0o7
We have to be alert that there shall be no new #Corona #hotspots. We have to be as careful as we have been all this while. Lockdown is extended till 2 May 2020, says @PMOIndia.
We have to be alert that there shall be no new #Corona #hotspots. We have to be as careful as we have been all this while. Lockdown is extended till 2 May 2020, says @PMOIndia
Back to working in North Block office with a home-made mask this morning. https://t.co/SlkxZdYuab

From a friend‚Äôs family in Gangtok, Sikkim. They wrote saying they lit the Chimi (butter lamps), ‚Äúoffering prayers for our fight against this global pandemic.‚Äù #IndiaFightsCoronavirus https://t.co/EuCKDkG7N5

Wish to thank the staff and officers of @FinMinIndia inclusive of those in PSBs who have come forward and contributed ‚Çπ430 crore towards @PMCares PM-CARES Fund to combat COVID-19 outbreak. https://t.co/ngZvE9JqV4.

Let‚Äôs defeat #Corona together. Let Ma Bharati win. Remember on Sunday, 5 April, give 9 minutes standing out of homes, either in your balcony or outside the doorway, keep a light in your hand& remember we are all together in this fight. Social distancing to be respected. @PMOIndia

On 5 April, Sunday, at 21:00 hrs switching off all lights, please stand out of your houses for nine minutes& keep a light- a candle, a Diya, a torch-remembering that we are not alone in this fight against #Corona . Please maintain social distancing even while doing so. @PMOIndia

It is certainly a lockdown. We are in  our homes, but we are not alone in this. We are all together and since we are each - Janata Janardan- a form of the Universal Supreme we have collective energy to fight this #Corona, says @PMOIndia

Appreciate the Principal Commisioner of Customs, Noida for issuing a timely Advisory on non-charging of container detention charges during the lockdown period. Facilitates Exporters/Importers in these extra ordinary situations. https://t.co/snt3EV9yCG

All banks are ensuring that their branches are kept open, ATMs filled up & are working. Banking correspondents are active. Social distancing is respected & sanitizers are provided where necessary. Just in case, any assistance/clarification is required contact @DFSFightsCorona
Appreciate the dedication. Effort to comply with social distancing, hand sanitising etc, are the need of the hour. In public interest. https://t.co/yO5jfHSFka

Had a detailed conversation with chiefs of Banks-public& private. Encouraging to know that they are doing their best, even during the lockdown. They are certain that they‚Äôll ensure customer service without disruption. Social distancing is being adhered to as well. @PIB_India

India in a 21 day lockdown to contain #COVID2019. @PMOIndia @narendramodi talks firm in the interest of each and every citizen. The Laxman Rekha can not be crossed. #StayHomeIndia. #Essentialservices shall be maintained. #EssentialWorkers shall be respected and honoured. https://t.co/BGbAfqQzQI

Even as we are readying an economic package to help us through the Corona lockdown (on priority, to be announced soon) I will address the media at 2pm today, specifically on statutory and regulatory compliance matters. Via video conference. @FinMinIndia @PIB_India @ANI @PTI_News
#CoronaVirus https://t.co/Ceo9Tg1guZ

"At last, COVID-19 vaccinations will commence this week. We will ensure that vaccines will be administered in a swift, safe and systematic manner."

"Today‚Äôs summit will serve as a new milestone for our mutually beneficial cooperation and common prosperity in the post-COVID-19 era."

Remarks by Pres. Moon (@moonriver365) during Visit to COVID-19 Vaccine Producing Company

"While stemming the spread of COVID-19,¬†we will do everything possible to protect people's livelihoods with an extraordinary sense of responsibility."

Remarks by Pres. Moon (@moonriver365) at Event to Promote AI in Connection with Korean New Deal

"The Republic of Korea‚Äôs dream is to become a leading nation in the post-COVID-19 era ‚Äì that is to say one that makes the most of AI."
